In addition, this subspecies of lion can weigh between 150 and 190 kg Transval South Africa This African lion is a variety from the southern part of Africa and is considered the brother of the katanga lion Barbary Forests of Africa This subspecies is one of the largest, characterized by a large and fertile mane East Africa East Africa Its body weight is the same as the lion species in general, which is between 150 to 200 kg Asia India This variety is smaller than other types of lions and has lighter fur, with a reddish mane in males // Data macan Srilanka Srilanka This leopard has brownish yellow or rusty fur with pink color and dark spots Jawa Jawa, Indonesia This leopard is completely black because of its recessive phenotype or has regular spotted fur Indochina South China and Southeast Asia Indochina leopard appears in predominantly black form Amur Southeastern Russia and Northeast China This animal differs from other leopard subspecies in that its thick, freckle-covered fur is suitable for survival in the cold climate in which this leopard lives North China North China This leopard is about the same size as the Amur leopard. But their fur is darker and more orange Persian Kaukasus The largest leopard subspecies and comes from the Caucasus region where its range includes Turkmenistan, Azerbaijan, Iran, and western Afghanistan // Data harimau Bengal India This tiger has orange fur with white tassels around the ears and black stripes on the back, and it has strong jaws, hind legs and strong front paws Indochina Indochina This Indochina tiger has a smaller body size. It also has a darker fur color Malaya Peninsular Malaysia The Malayan tiger bears many similarities to the Indochina tiger Sumatera Sumatera, Indonesia This tiger belongs to a small tiger.
